title: Alex Bregman opts out of Red Sox contract, will hit free agency
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Bregman opted out of his Red Sox contract and will become a free agent this offseason.
Bregman had two years and $80 million left on his contract but seeks a longer, more lucrative deal.
The Red Sox may compete with teams like the Tigers and Mariners to retain Bregman's services.

title: Patriots NFL trade deadline live updates: Will New England make moves before Tuesday?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots considering roster upgrades before Tuesday's 4 p.m. NFL trade deadline; decisions pending on acquiring new talent.
New England may trade OLB Anfernee Jennings, who hasn't started this season, despite starting 30 games previously.
Eagles acquire Dolphins' Jaelan Phillips for a third-round pick; Patriots missed out on the edge rusher option.

title: After an eventful week, Bruins’ Hampus Lindholm has ‘a lot to be thankful for’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm returned to the Boston Bruins lineup after a lower-body injury, significantly improving their defensive performance.
Lindholm and his fiancée welcomed their first child, Magnolia, named after their favorite tree.
The Bruins are 5-1-0 with Lindholm playing, compared to 2-6-0 during his injury absence.

title: Stefon Diggs playfully roasts Cardi B’s dance moves during Gillette Stadium appearance
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Cardi B attended the Patriots' game at Gillette Stadium, watching from the owner's suite alongside Robert Kraft.
Stefon Diggs humorously critiqued Cardi B's dance imitation of his touchdown celebration, describing her moves as 'a little shaky.'
Patriots secured their sixth consecutive win by narrowly defeating the Falcons, after a missed extra point secured a 1-point victory.

title: A bipartisan group of Mass. lawmakers called on Markey and Warren to help end the shutdown
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: 32 Massachusetts lawmakers urged Senators Markey and Warren to help end the prolonged government shutdown.
The shutdown, now the longest in U.S. history, affects SNAP benefits, small businesses, and 25,000 federal employees in Massachusetts.
Lawmakers request a 'clean' spending bill to end the shutdown, with Markey and Warren previously opposing similar measures.

title: ‘Unaffordable and nearly unlivable’: What readers want Mayor Wu and City Councilors to prioritize
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Housing affordability remains a top concern for Boston voters, with residents citing high rents and insufficient zoning as issues.
Public safety and infrastructure challenges, including traffic congestion and MBTA reliability, are important voter priorities for city elections.
Immigration policies divide Boston readers, with some advocating for support and others calling for resource reallocation.

title: Business confidence in Massachusetts drops again, report says
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Massachusetts business confidence fell in October due to rising prices, federal disruptions, and tariff uncertainties, says AIM index.
The AIM Business Confidence Index has reported eight months of pessimism, last seen during COVID-19 in 2020.
The index faced challenges from federal shutdowns impacting economic analysis and productivity, survey involved over 140 employers.

title: Boston Legacy FC announce date of 2026 home opener
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Boston Legacy FC will play their first NWSL game at Gillette Stadium on March 14, 2026.
The match will be nationally broadcasted, though the opponent is not yet announced.
The team must sign a full roster as no traditional expansion draft will occur.

title: Six straight wins later — are the Patriots officially back?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: The New England Patriots are on a six-game win streak, elevating their record to 7-2 under rookie QB Drake Maye.
Mike Vrabel, in his first year as head coach, praises the team's resilience after a narrow 24-23 win over the Falcons.
Standout performances by Stefon Diggs, Rhamondre Stevenson, and DeMario Douglas contribute to the Patriots' early-season success.

title: New UMass poll shows Markey with firm lead over Moulton
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: UMass Amherst/WCVB poll shows Ed Markey leading Seth Moulton 51% to 28% among likely Democratic primary voters.
In a potential four-way race with Pressley, Markey leads with 35%, followed by Moulton at 25% and Pressley at 21%.
Poll indicates concerns for Markey, with 'old' as top descriptor; Markey holds 54% approval rating, up from earlier 51%.
